attributes.action: To Leave the EU as the British People Voted to.
attributes.additional_details:
Remain Vote At 48.1% - 16,141,241 Voted to remain in the EU
Leave Vote At 51.9% - 17,410,742 Voted to Leave the EU
There should not be a 2nd Referendum Vote due to only a 72% turn out as not all people are interested in voting.
attributes.background: The British People Voted to leave the EU on Thursday 23rd June 2016, it should now be left at that. A 2nd referendum should not be carried out as it has been made clear by the British people they would like to leave the EU, as the leave vote was at 51.9%.
